solution.text:
volume of the cuboid = volume of the 2 cylinders
volume of the cuboid =
Volume of the cuboid =\(l\times b \times h\), where \(l\) is length, \(b\) is width and \(h\) is height
\(\Rightarrow \) Volume of the cuboid\(=_{{j*j*2}}_ \times _{k}_ \times 3.14\)
volume of the cylinders\(=2\times [ \pi \times r^2 \times height]\)
height of the cylinders = height of the cuboid= _{k}_
volume of the cylinders\(= 2\times [ 3.14 \times r^2 \times _{k}_]\)
Now the volumes are equal therefore, \(r^2\times 2\times 3.14 \times _{k}_=_{{j*j*2}}_ \times _{k}_ \times 3.14 \)
\(\Rightarrow r=_{j}_\)

content.text:
A box in the shape of a cuboid is made up of clay.
A child reshapes it into 2 similar cylinders of height same as that of the cuboid.
If width of the cuboid is 3.14 cm, length is _{{2*j*j}}_cm and height is _{k}_cm, find the radius of the cylinder.(use\(\pi \)=3.14)
